intro: Neblinaria celiae, commonly known as the cloud mist orchid, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the high-altitude cloud forests of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, strap-like leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in shades of white and pale pink. The plant thrives in cool, humid environments and requires well-drained, acidic soil to flourish. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Neblinaria celiae is considered endangered and is often found in protected reserves. Its unique appearance and ecological significance make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists alike.
